substitution.copyText: '' Be something seanter of your maiden presence | '' Set your entreatments at a higher rate | '' Than a command to parley; for Lord Hamlet, | '' And with a larger tedder may he walk | '' Than may be given you: in tew Ophelia, | '' Do not believe his vows; for they Brokers, | '' Not of that dye which their investments shew, | '' But meer implorators of unholy fuits, | '' Breathing like fanctified and pious bonds, | '' The better to beguile:
''and takes his towse, |'' “Keep wassel, and the swaggerong up spring reels,
And as he takes his draughts of Rhenish down,
substitution.amendedText: And as he drinks his draughts of Rhenish down,

substitution.copyText: '' This heavy-headed revel East and West | '' Makes us traduc’d and taxed of other Nations; | '' The clepe us Drunkards, and with swinish phrase | '' Soil our addition; and indeed it takes | '' From our achievements, though performed at height, | '' The pith and marrow of our attribute: '' So oft it chances in particular men, '' That for some vicious mole of nature in them, '' As in their birth, wherein they are not guilty,
